item.title: Telangana civic polls: BRS candidate loses by 2 votes in Gadwal
item.description:
<![CDATA[Hyderabad: A Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) candidate, Jayamma, who had won by a very thin margin in the eighth ward of Gadwal municipality elections in Telangana on Friday, February 13, reportedly lost after a Congress candidate called for a recount of the votes.
According to local reports, the BRS candidate had initially won by a margin of three votes; however, the Congress candidate objected and asked for a recount. After four recounts, Jayamma was declared the winner by two votes.
Later, the...]]>

item.title: BRS candidate, who won by one-vote margin, loses by 1 vote after recounting
item.description:
<![CDATA[Brs Candidate Who Won By One Vote Margin Loses By 1 Vote After Recounting
BRS candidate, who won by one-vote margin, loses by 1 vote after recounting
A dramatic turn unfolded in Jogulamba Gadwalâ€™s municipal elections when the BRS candidate Jayamma, initially declared winner in the eighth ward, lost by a single vote after a recount demanded by Congress candidate Venkatamma.
By Telangana Today Published Date - 13 February 2026, 06:53 PM

item.title: Kavitha makes a mark in municipal polls
item.description:
<![CDATA[Hyderabad
In an interesting twist in the municipal polls, the All India Forward Bloc (AIFB) has secured a decisive victory in Vaddepalli municipality of Jogulamba Gadwal district.
The Forward Block won eight seats out of the 10, while the Congress and BRS secured one seat each. The AIFB candidates were supported by Telangana Jagruthi leader K. Kavitha, who had announced before the polls that her candidates would be contesting on the AIFB platform as the Telangana Jagruthi was yet to be launche...]]>
item.author: Authors

item.title: Telangana Municipal Polls 2026 updates: Congress gains a clear lead with victory in 1,526 Wards, BRS wins in 772
item.description:
<![CDATA[The ruling Congress party in Telangana is leading in the Municipal Polls-2026. The main opposition, Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), fared well and it was in the second position.
Out of the 2,958 Wards whose results were declared, Congress candidates won in 1,526 Wards, and BRS candidates claimed victory in 772, according to Telangana State Election Commission data till 8.40 p.m. Though the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) expected to make a dent, it won in 326 Wards. All India Majlis-E-Ittehadul (AIM...]]>
